title: [Large-Scale] Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Program Based on Design Studio

context.prior_knowledge: Basic design theory and knowledge of tool utilization
context.additional_context: An environment enabling access to basic design tools via smartphones, requiring the application of design thinking to solve real-world professional challenges.

learning_goals: Learners can develop design prototypes that solve real-world social problems through project-based learning
Learners can derive user-centered creative solutions at least three times by applying the design thinking process.
Learners can complete a complex problem-solving process at least once through role distribution with team members in a collaborative learning environment.

During 3 weeks of experiential learning, learners can visualize physical media (at least 3 sketches, 1 model) and digital media (at least 2 ideas using Adobe Illustrator or Figma) in a design studio, receive feedback from at least 3 peers and 1 expert, and submit improved final outputs (sketches/models/digital files).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
